revised_title: Kinetics of Dissociation of Ligand Molecules from Haemoglobin
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the rate of dissociation of the first ligand molecule from fully saturated carboxyhaemoglobin and nitric oxide haemoglobin in sheep blood solutions. They found that the velocity constant of dissociation is simply proportional to the number of combined ligand molecules. The results support the view that the kinetics of reactions of ligand molecules and haemoglobin molecules are subject to simple statistical principles.
